His abdomen is soft with no guarding or rigidity, and bowel sounds are normal. Laboratory tests reveal leukocytosis and elevated lactate levels. What is the most likely diagnosis?

She reports vomiting after meals and feels relieved when lying in the left lateral decubitus position. An upper GI contrast study reveals compression of the third part of the duodenum between the superior mesenteric artery (SMA) and the aorta. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old man presents with chronic abdominal pain, weight loss, and intermittent diarrhea for the past 3 months. He also reports occasional episodes of low-grade fever and night sweats. On examination, there is abdominal distension and a palpable mass in the right iliac fossa. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is the most common site of intestinal involvement in tuberculosis?

A patient with Short Bowel Syndrome is started on parenteral nutrition due to severe malabsorption. Which of the following complications is the patient most at risk for?

A 70-year-old male with a history of chronic hypertension and coronary artery disease presents with abdominal pain after eating and significant weight loss over the last 3 months. A CT angiography reveals narrowing of the mesenteric arteries. Which watershed area is most susceptible to ischemia in this patient?
Which of the following clinical scenarios is most likely to result in ischemic injury to watershed areas in the brain?

A 55-year-old male undergoes a colonoscopy, which reveals a 4 cm tumor in the sigmoid colon. A biopsy confirms adenocarcinoma. CT scan shows tumor invasion into the pericolonic fat but no lymph node or distant metastasis. What is the TNM stage of this cancer?
